meaningMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>surplus</kanji> so the verb version would be <vocabulary>to be in surplus</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>to remain left over</vocabulary>, or <vocabulary>to be in excess</vocabulary>. Too much!
readingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: "I have a surplus of kittens from that last batch we made, Reddit. <reading>AMA</reading> (ask me anything, あま)."
